info.title: Agent Basic Information
info.description: In the Nordic Smart Government information exchange context the agent represents both registered organizations ("companies") and persons who are doing business without being registered organizations, usually as sole traders (sole proprietors). This data product definition returns basic information content for any agent.

parameters.description: The login token. Value should be "Bearer [token]"

schema.title: Authorization
schema.description: The login token. Value should be "Bearer [token]"

parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: The bare domain of the system that provided the token.

schema.title: X-Authorization-Provider
schema.description: The bare domain of the system that provided the token.

parameters.name: x-authorization-provider

nationalIdentifier.title: National Identifier
nationalIdentifier.description: National identifier for a legal entity

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the legal entity

legalForm.title: Legal form
legalForm.description:

registrationDate.title: Registration date
registrationDate.description: Official registration date of the legal entity in the national trade registry

fullAddress.title: Full address
fullAddress.description: The complete address written as a string. Use of this property is recommended as it will not suffer any misunderstandings that might arise through the breaking up of an address into its component parts.

thoroughfare.title: Thoroughfare
thoroughfare.description: The name of a passage or way through from one location to another. A thoroughfare is usually a street, but it might be a waterway or some other feature.

locatorDesignator.title: Locator designator
locatorDesignator.description: A number or sequence of characters that uniquely identifies the locator within the relevant scope. In simpler terms, this is the building number, apartment number, etc.

locatorName.title: Locator name
locatorName.description: Proper noun(s) applied to the real world entity identified by the locator. The locator name could be the name of the property or complex, of the building or part of the building, or it could be the name of a room inside a building. The key difference between a locator and a locator name is that the latter is a proper name and is unlikely to include digits.

addressArea.title: Address area
addressArea.description: The name of a geographic area that groups Addresses. This would typically be part of a city, a neighbourhood or village. Address area is not an administrative unit.

postCode.title: Post code
postCode.description: The code created and maintained for postal purposes to identify a subdivision of addresses and postal delivery points.

postName.title: Post name
postName.description: A name created and maintained for postal purposes to identify a subdivision of addresses and postal delivery points. Usually a city.

poBox.title: PO box
poBox.description: A location designator for a postal delivery point at a post office, usually a number.

adminUnitLevel_1.title: Admin unit level 1
adminUnitLevel_1.description: The name of the uppermost level of the address, almost always a country. ISO 3166 two character (Alpha 2) format

adminUnitLevel_2.title: Admin unit level 2
adminUnitLevel_2.description: The name of a secondary level/region of the address, usually a county, state or other such area that typically encompasses several localities. Values could be a region or province, more granular than level 1.

addressId.title: Address id
addressId.description: A globally unique identifier for each instance of an Address. The concept of adding a globally unique identifier for each instance of an address is a crucial part of the INSPIRE data spec. A number of EU countries have already implemented an ID (a UUID) in their Address Register, among them Denmark.
